author: ralexstokes

> many wrong votes for target even in late slots in the epoch

content: i chalked it up to poor network integrity given testnet conditions

content: do you have any numbers on the data you are seeing on pyrmont?

author: potuz
content: I am still gathering, just started today will post probably the day after tomorrow, last I checked 77% of the votes on slot 0 mod 32 where wrong

content: and on mainnet it was about 30%

author: ralexstokes

author: potuz
content: I started collecting again cause I want to correlate also head vote with the client proposing the previous vote, and the delay in the block, this will take a couple of days

author: ajsutton
content: Just to confirm, you mean the target root is wrong, not the head root right?

author: potuz
content: well on slot 0 it means both

author: potuz
content: you get both the target and the head wrong

author: potuz
content: when you didn't get the first block

author: potuz
content: But I am seeing target wrong on later slots as well, also with wrong head of course but the latter I understand more

author: ajsutton
content: Yeah, later in the epoch I can understand head being wrong, but agree its very surprising that target is.

author: potuz
content: I'll have enough to post something meaningful by client tomorrow,  there should be a clear correlation between arrival time and vote, but I also wander about the clients themselves. What I am doing is very straightforward: grab slot, delay, graffiti for the block in slot N and the votes for the block in slot N+1, declare correct those that had the same root as the block my node thought is target in slot 0 and  declare correct votes on head those votes on the root of slot N. So I am assuming that a) My node is on the canonical chain and b) all blocks I am getting are on the canonical chain. This is a strong asumption but it's fine in the long term since I only care about aggregates. So I am seeing obvious correlations that slot came late, head vote was bad. But also I seeing some other weird stuff

author: potuz
content: I ran with newer data for about a day collection and got 17,5% this time, matches up with my own improvement on slot 0 and some issues open on prysm. Will post all findings in a bit
